page.title: 13THE METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: The present Methodist Church was built in 1914 replacing a former Chapel built in 1836. It is said that Charles Wesley visited the village when he was Preaching. The members of the Church hold many fund_raising activities and also hold meetings for various groups of people. A Sunday School has been in existence for many years and at present it is a very thriving concern. The children are very much inspired by the activities set before them & have put on musical productions which have been well supported by the local residents. They study the Bible and take exams in which they are highly successful.The children also enjoy trips out to visit places of interest. On several occasions the Methodist Church joins St.Giles Church for united services.
